result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamila N Troop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAY restitution in the amount of $3,750.00 to the victim, Wells Fargo Bank located at 4015 N. Oakland Avenue, Shorewood, WI, JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actor Phillip Conner (15CF1577).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the Wells Fargo Bank employee, Labirea W.
No contact with any Wells Fargo Banks.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Complete a parenting class.
Complete a cognitive behavior therapy class.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Milwaukee Women's Correctional Center 615 West Keefe Ave. Milwaukee WI 53212

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP, signed and filed. 
The Court orders the petition for sentence adjustment is granted because it is in the public interest and is not based on a change in law or procedure.  The inmate's term of confinement in prison and term of extended supervision shall be adjusted pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195(1r)(g).  The Department of Corrections shall effectuate this change from confinement to extended supervision within 30 days from the date of this order and change the remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  The overall length of the bifurcated sentence is not changed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 18 Judge Colon. os

Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (23 pages) commencing 07/01/2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Jamila N Troop in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jamila N Troop in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 80 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the Wells Fargo Bank employee, Labirea W.
* No contact with any Wells Fargo Banks.
* Complete a parenting class.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy class.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $3,750.00 to the victim, Wells Fargo Bank located at 4015 N. Oakland Avenue, Shorewood, WI, JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actor Phillip Conner (15CF1577).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation oof Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Restitution Worksheet.
Defendant's Letter of Apology.

Defendant Jamila N Troop in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jamila N Troop in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Robbery with Threat of Force as a Party to a Crime [a Class E FELONY], contrary to Wisconsin Stats. Sec. 943.32(1)(a) and (b), 939.05.

**NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
